business.headline: Mobikwik IPO fully subscribed on Day 1. What's behind the strong demand?Mobikwik's IPO was subscribed over 3.5 times as of 1 pm. According to data, Mobikwik's IPO received bids for 3,96,80,623 shares against the 1,18,71,696 shares on offer.

LIC Bima Sakhi Yojana explained: Check eligibility, and stipendThe LIC Bima Sakhi Yojana empowers women aged 18-70 with training, stipends, and LIC agent roles, promoting financial inclusion and independence.

Explained: Why PNC Infratech share price jumped 12% todayAt around 12:08 pm, shares of PNC Infratech were trading 9.81% higher at Rs 341.25. The strong performance came after the civil construction firm announced the early completion of a key highway project, boosting investor sentiment.

Why Adani Ports decided to opt out of $553 million US loan for Sri Lanka projectAdani Ports and Special Economic Zone Ltd (APSEZ) said it would instead use its own resources to fund the project, citing alignment with its capital management plans.
Elon Musk's Tesla resumes hunt for New Delhi showroom with DLF: ReportTesla has resumed showroom space searches in New Delhi, exploring options with DLF, as it reconsiders entering India.

RVNL, Titagarh, Jupiter Wagons: Why railway stocks are rallying todayRailway stocks: Share price of stocks from the railway sector such as IRCTC, RVNL, Titagarh, IRFC, Jupiter Wagons, witnessed a rise in early trade on Wedesday after major announcements from the government

Vedanta share price surges over 4%. Check key factors behind today's rallyVedanta share price today: The rally can be attributed to several factors, including operational enhancements, bullish market sentiment, and positive brokerage ratings.

Sai Life Sciences IPO opens: Should you apply? Check all details, latest GMPSai Life Sciences IPO: The public offering includes a fresh share issue worth Rs 950 crore, while promoters and existing shareholders will offload 3.81 crore shares amounting to Rs 2,092.62 crore.
Mobikwik IPO open for bidding: Subscribe or skip? Check latest GMPMobikwik IPO for bidding: The Mobikwik IPO aims to raise Rs 572 crore and will close for subscription on December 13, 2024.
Sensex, Nifty open flat as inflation data keeps market on edgeThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 1.44 points to 81,511.49, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 13.85 points to 24,623.90.

Vishal Mega Mart IPO: Should you subscribe? Check latest GMPVishal Mega Mart IPO: The public offering is entirely an offer for sale of 102.56 crore shares, which means the company will receive no capital from the listing and all proceeds will go to the selling shareholders.

Adani Ports shares to be in spotlight today. Here's why Adani group stocks: Shares of Adani Ports are expected to be in focus today after the firm shared a crucial announcement to the stock exchanges for one of its projects in Sri Lanka.

PAN 2.0: A step-by-step guide to applying for a reprint with QR codeIndian PAN cardholders can now reprint their PAN card with a QR code for just Rs 50 through Protean or UTIITSL portals, the process of which is simple and user-friendly.

Stocks to watch today: Adani Ports, Bajaj Auto, NTPC Green EnergySeveral stocks are likely to be in focus due to recent news and developments, such as Adani Ports, Adani Green Energy, Bajaj Auto, Star Health, Awfis Space, NTPC Green, among others.

Will use own resources: Adani Ports opts out of US funding for Colombo Port projectAdani Ports said the Colombo Port project was on track for commissioning by early next year and that it will fund the project through "internal accruals", aligning with its capital management strategy.

Haldiram's attracts bids from Alpha Wave, 2 others for 15-20% stake: ReportThe bids, which could mark one of India's largest private-equity deals, peg the company's valuation at Rs 75,000-80,000 crore ($8.8-9.4 billion).

Sanjay Malhotra's focus as RBI Governor: 3 key areas to watch out forBrokerage firm Nomura anticipates Sanjay Malhotra's tenure as RBI Governor may bring rate cuts, foster credit growth, and allow flexible currency management amid economic challenges.
PAN Card for minors: Benefits, documents and application process Securing a PAN card for your child ensures smooth financial transactions and better preparation for future responsibilities.
Sensex, Nifty close flat; IT leads way, rupee hits record lowThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 1.59 points to end at 81,510.05, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 8.95 points to close at 24,610.05.

FMCG sector slowdown: Can consumer stocks stage a comeback? After a promising run earlier this year, the FMCG sector seems to be stuck in a rough patch, as its stocks have not been performing well and has left investors wondering.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Rahul Gandhi says House must run, ally Trinamool says Congress-BJP dictating itRahul Gandhi asserted that the Opposition's main aim was to allow Parliament to function and insisted that the Constitution debate should take place on December 13.

PM's adviser clarifies funding from George Soros charge: No money came directlyShamika Ravi has shot back at Congress leader Pawan Khera after he claimed that she had received funds from an organisation funded by American investor George Soros.

Corbett cameras used to spy on women? Probe on, but eyes wide shutDigital devices, including camera traps, were being used by male villagers and forest guards to monitor women who go into the forest for foraging. This was first reported by India Today Digital on November 25. A probe is on but officials are promising nothing more even after two weeks.

Removing Rajya Sabha Chairman Dhankhar won't be a cakewalk. Here's whyThe Opposition has submitted a notice for a no-confidence motion against Rajya Sabha Chairman Jagdeep Dhankhar. While no Vice-President has ever been removed from office, the Constitution outlines a rigorous process for the removal. Does the NDA have enough MPs to beat the Opposition move?

Kareena Kapoor gets PM Modi's autograph for her sons as she meets him with familyThe Kapoor family met PM Modi to invite him to the RK Film Festival on December 14, commemorating Raj Kapoor's 100th birth anniversary. Kareena even got an autograph for her sons.

Bengaluru techie suicide: A reality check of family court systemAtul Subhash Suicide Case: The over 20-page suicide note by Bengaluru techie Atul Subhash raised serious allegations against his wife, his family and even the family court system for pushing him towards the decision to end his life.

Rahul Gandhi gives rose, Tricolour to Rajnath Singh during Parliament protestIn a unique gesture of protest, Congress MP and Leader of Opposition in the Lok Sabha, Rahul Gandhi, handed a rose and a Tricolour to Defence Minister Rajnath Singh at the Parliament premises.

3rd Test: Gabba curator hints at pacey Brisbane pitchIND vs AUS: Gabba curator David Sandurski has hinted that the Brisbane track is expected to have its usual bounce and carry. Sandurski spoke about preparation of the wicket before the third Test match.

Mukherjee Nagar: Is Delhi's UPSC capital dying? | India Today Culture ProjectOnce the beating heart of UPSC dreams, Mukherjee Nagar was more than a locality — it was a way of life for aspirants chasing India's toughest exam.

Kiren Rijiju rips into Opposition for no-trust motion against Jagdeep DhankharThe Rajya Sabha descended into chaos on Wednesday as the government and opposition clashed over the no-confidence motion against Vice President and Rajya Sabha Chairman Jagdeep Dhankhar.

'Welcome' actor called for award show in UP, kidnapped, then tortured for 12 hoursAfter comedian Sunil Pal, actor Mushtaq Khan claims that he was kidnapped on the pretext of being invited to an event. A police complaint regarding the same has been filed.

South Korea ex-minister attempts suicide using underwear over failed martial lawThe incident comes as police has intensified their investigation, which includes a search of President Yoon Suk Yeol's office.

Total Solar Eclipse in 2024 created gravity waves, ripples on EarthDuring the April 8, 2024, total solar eclipse, scientists observed the ionosphere — a charged layer in Earth's upper atmosphere — rising in altitude during the eclipse.
From Creta EV to e Vitara, BE 6, Cyberster: Stars at Bharat MobilityBharat Mobility Global Expo 2025 will be held from January 17 to January 22.

Arvind Kejriwal says 'no possibility of alliance' with Congress for Delhi pollsAAP chief Arvind Kejriwal categorically ruled out any possibility of an alliance with the Congress for the upcoming Delhi assembly elections, reaffirming that his party will contest the polls "on its own strength".

Sequel culture in Indian films: Risk worth taking or milked for craze?The rise of sequels in Indian cinema, particularly pan-India projects, mirrors global trends by blending commercial appeal with expansive narratives. However, these films are increasingly criticised for their template-driven, formulaic structure, which risks overshadowing originality and innovation.

Aishwarya Rai, Abhishek Bachchan's old video dancing to Desi Girl goes viralAishwarya Rai and Abhishek Bachchan's old video dancing to the song, Desi Girl, has gone viral. The two were also joined by their daughter Aaradhya.

INS Tushil to bolster India's naval power amid expanding defence diplomacyThe commissioning of the multi-role stealth missile frigate reflects India's focus on maritime security while balancing partnerships with both Russia and the West

Supreme Court relaxes Manish Sisodia's bail conditions in liquor policy caseThe Supreme Court eased bail conditions for former Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia, stating that it wasn't necessary for him to report to the offices of the CBI and the Enforcement Directorate twice a week.

In U-turn, Bangladesh confirms 88 attacks on minorities after India censureIn a big acknowledgement, Bangladesh has now officially accepted that as many as 88 incidents of communal violence against minorities, primarily Hindus, have happened following the ouster of Sheikh Hasina government in August.

Anushka-Virat's son Akaay makes it to Google's Year in Search 2024 listAnushka Sharma and Virat Kohli's son, Akaay's name secured the second position in Google's Year in Search 2024 under the 'meaning' sub-category.

Cruelty law being misused for personal vendetta against husband: Supreme CourtThe Supreme Court made the observation while setting aside a cruelty case lodged by a woman against her husband and his family which the Telangana High Court had refused to dismiss earlier.

Can Rishabh Pant repeat 2021 Gabba heroics as India eye comeback?AUS vs IND: India wicketkeeper batter Rishabh Pant will return to the very place which etched his name in the annals of history as India aim to make a comeback in the series.

Planet with a 5,63,000-km-long tail discovered outside Solar SystemThe planet is experiencing significant atmospheric loss — about 2,00,000 tons per second — primarily composed of light gases such as hydrogen and helium.

Video: Mohanlal greets Akshay Kumar with a hug at Barroz trailer launchThe trailer of Mohanlal-starrer Barroz was launched today in Mumbai. The Malayalam superstar was seen greeting Akshay Kumar, a special guest at the trailer launch, with a warm hug.

Keerthy Suresh's wedding 'madness begins' in GoaActor Keerthy Suresh and Antony Thattil will get married on December 12 in Goa. The actor shared a photo to give us a glimpse of the wedding preparations.

Uorfi Javed slams oral hygiene brand for inappropriate 'strip it down' requestActor-influencer Uorfi Javed has publicly criticised an oral hygiene brand for asking her to strip for a promotional campaign. She described the request as 'invasive' and warned them of the consequences.
Megan Fox, Machine Gun Kelly break up weeks after pregnancy announcement: ReportMegan Fox and Machine Gun Kelly have reportedly ended their relationship shortly before welcoming their child.

sports.headline: Under-pressure Rohit Sharma must tick 2 boxes in Brisbane Test, say punditsAustralia vs India, 3rd Test: Rohit Sharma has been dismissed for eight single-digit scores in his last 12 innings in Tests. The India captain needs to return to form with the bat to feel more confident as a leader, said Cheteshwar Pujara and Harbhajan Singh.

BBL: Marcus Stoinis replaces Glenn Maxwell to become new Melbourne Stars captainMelbourne Stars have announced Marcus Stoinis as their new captain, replacing fellow all-rounder Glenn Maxwell. Stoinis has been with the Stars since the third season of the Big Bash League.

Isa Guha outlines major Jasprit Bumrah concern for India ahead of 3rd TestIND vs AUS: Former England cricketer Isa Guha feels that Jasprit Bumrah's fitness is a major concern for India ahead of the 3rd Test match in Brisbane. Bumrah was taken off the attack after bowling just 4 overs on Day 2 morning session of the 2nd Test match.

Aus vs Ind: Cost of Adelaide 'beer snake' that angered Mohammed Siraj revealedA man with a beer snake who halted play during day 1 of the second Test between India and Australia revealed the cost of his creation and apologised to Marnus Labuschagne.

Pressure on entire top order, not just Usman Khawaja: David Warner sends warningDavid Warner has sent a warning to the Australian top order, saying that the pressure will be on all of them to perform and not just Usman Khawaja. The Aussie opener, along with the likes of Steve Smith and Mitchell Marsh, has failed to inspire in the 2 Tests so far.

3rd Test: Gabba curator hints at pacey Brisbane pitchIND vs AUS: Gabba curator David Sandurski has hinted that the Brisbane track is expected to have its usual bounce and carry. Sandurski spoke about preparation of the wicket before the third Test match.

Watch: Shubman Gill poses for selfie with fan as Team India arrives in BrisbaneAustralia vs India:  Shubman Gill took time out to pose for a selfie with a fan at Brisbane Airport on Wednesday. Team India players arrived in the city ahead of the third Test, starting December 14 at the Gabba.

Watch: Team India players arrive in Brisbane ahead of third Test at GabbaBorder-Gavaskar Trophy: Indian cricket team players landed in Brisbane on Wednesday morning ahead of the third Test, starting December 14 at the Gabba. Batting star Shubman Gill posed for a selfie with a fan.

India tour of England 2025: Ticket craze for Edgbaston Test sets new recordIndia tour of England 2025: In a first for a non-Ashes Test in England, the tickets for the first four days of the Edgbaston Test in Birmingham have been sold out. India will play a five-match series in the Old Blightly from June 20 to August 4.

Got worried for Mohammed Siraj after Travis Head send-off: Ricky PontingRicky Ponting claimed that he got worried for Mohammed Siraj after his Travis Head send-off during the Adelaide Test. Siraj and Head got into a fiery exchange after the Indian pacer had dismissed the Aussie batter on Day 2.

Virat Kohli-Anuskha Sharma's 7th wedding anniversary: RCB, fans send in wishesRoyal Challengers Bengaluru and fans joined in to wish Virat Kohli and Anushka Sharma on their 7th wedding anniversary. Kohli and Anushka got married in 2017.

India will play a five-match series in the Old Blightly from June 20 to August 4.

Virat Kohli-Anuskha Sharma's 7th wedding anniversary: RCB, fans send in wishesRoyal Challengers Bengaluru and fans joined in to wish Virat Kohli and Anushka Sharma on their 7th wedding anniversary. Kohli and Anushka got married in 2017.

Rohit Sharma should sacrifice his position for India's future: PujaraIND vs AUS, 3rd Test: Rohit Sharma should continue to bat in the middle-order feels Cheteshwar Pujara. Pujara wants KL Rahul and Yashasvi Jaiswal to continue in the top order keeping India's future in mind.

Kylian Mbappe injured? Ancelotti hopes no serious issue with Real Madrid starReal Madrid boss Carlo Ancelotti is hoping that Kylian Mbappe's injury he sustained in the UEFA Champions League clash against Atalanta on Tuesday, December 10. Mbappe was in fine form during the match before the injury forced him off the field.

Can Rishabh Pant repeat 2021 Gabba heroics as India eye comeback?AUS vs IND: India wicketkeeper batter Rishabh Pant will return to the very place which etched his name in the annals of history as India aim to make a comeback in the series.

Babar Azam scores 0 in 1st T20I, sparks hilarious reactionsSenior Pakistan batter Babar Azam failed in the 1st T20I vs South Africa. Babar's duck resulted in some hilarious takes about his form on social media.

Josh Hazlewood in, Scott Boland out for Gabba Test? Brett Lee delivers verdictBrett Lee feels that Josh Hazlewood should be part of Australia's lineup for the Gabba Test if he is fit and ready. Lee said that Hazlewood should come in place of Scott Boland, despite the pacer's brilliant performance in the Adelaide Test win.

UEFA Champions League: Real Madrid snap losing run, Liverpool remain unbeatenReal Madrid halted their losing streak with a thrilling 3-2 victory over Atalanta, while Liverpool continued their winning run by defeating Girona. Bayern Munich also secured a commanding win over Shakhtar Donetsk.

Jayden Seales, Brandon King help Windies clinch series with clinical winWI vs BAN: Hosts West Indies beat Bangladesh in the second ODI of the series to take an unassailable lead of 2-0. Jayden Seales won the player of the match award with a sensational four-wicket haul.

Lee said that Hazlewood should come in place of Scott Boland, despite the pacer's brilliant performance in the Adelaide Test win.

SA vs PAK: Linde, Miller star as South Africa down Pakistan in 1st T20IGeorge Linde's all-round brilliance and David Miller's explosive batting helped an inexperienced South African side down Pakistan in the first T20I of the series on Tuesday, December 10. Linde picked up 4 wickets and scored 48 runs to help his side win in Durban.

Juventus must be in top form to pose Manchester City problems: Thiago MottaJuventus manager Thiago Motta acknowledged the challenge posed by Manchester City in a high-stakes clash between two European powerhouses striving to reignite their Champions League campaigns.

Napoli's Kvaratskhelia ruled out till January after suffering knee injuryNapoli have confirmed that Khvicha Kvaratskhelia will miss action until January 2025 due to a knee ligament tear, leaving Antonio Conte's team without their star winger during crucial Serie A fixtures in an intense title race.

Mohammed Siraj responds to ICC fine after bust-up with Travis HeadMohammed Siraj has broken his silence following the ICC sanctions imposed on him and Travis Head after their heated exchange during the Adelaide Test.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
